message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "The study utilizes data from the World Development Indicators (WDI) and the Global Findex database to examine the impact of financial inclusion on poverty reduction.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators (WDI)", "Global Findex"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "The analysis is based on a new dataset constructed by combining household survey data with satellite-based measurements of vegetation cover as well as meteorological data from the Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station data (CHIRPS).", "dataset": ["household survey data", "satellite-based measurements of vegetation cover", "meteorological data from the Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station data (CHIRPS)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "To address this, we use a dataset consisting of high-frequency measurements of electricity consumption by customers of the national grid in Nigeria and Ghana, combined with survey data from a large-scale customer survey in both countries.", "dataset": ["high-frequency measurements of electricity consumption", "survey data from a large-scale customer survey"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We used data collected through the Afghanistan Living Conditions Survey (ALCS) conducted in 2016-17, which provides information on employment patterns, education levels, and demographic characteristics of households in Afghanistan.", "dataset": ["Afghanistan Living Conditions Survey (ALCS)"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "To explore this issue, we use a dataset containing information on the environmental and social policies of firms that are part of the Carbon Disclosure Project (CDP), a voluntary disclosure initiative.", "dataset": ["Carbon Disclosure Project (CDP)"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys, which provides information on firms' experience with bribery and corruption as well as their general business environment.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "In this paper, we use a dataset from the Mexican government that combines administrative data on program participation with survey data to study the effects of social protection programs on educational outcomes of children in Mexico.", "dataset": ["dataset from the Mexican government"], "topic": ["Education", "Social Protection"]}, {"sentence": "We employ a newly collected dataset consisting of public procurement contracts awarded by Italian public authorities between 2012 and 2017, linked at both the contract level and firm level with various other datasets from national statistics agencies.", "dataset": ["public procurement contracts awarded by Italian public authorities", "datasets from national statistics agencies"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships"]}, {"sentence": "Using a dataset on cross-border bank lending between advanced and emerging economies during the period 2000-16, we examine the factors driving bank flows to developing countries.", "dataset": ["dataset on cross-border bank lending"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "We combine data on hydro-meteorological hazards and road disruptions with a dataset on network infrastructure investment to explore how investment can mitigate the impacts of hazards and disruption.", "dataset": ["data on hydro-meteorological hazards", "road disruptions", "dataset on network infrastructure investment"], "topic": ["Transport", "Disaster Risk Management"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "The study utilizes data from the World Development Indicators (WDI) and the Global Findex database to examine the impact of financial inclusion on poverty reduction.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators (WDI)", "Global Findex"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "The analysis is based on a new dataset constructed by combining household survey data with satellite-based measurements of vegetation cover as well as meteorological data from the Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station data (CHIRPS).", disclosure initiative.", "dataset": ["Carbon Disclosure Project (CDP)"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys, which provides information on firms' experience with bribery and corruption as well as their general business environment.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "In this paper, we use a dataset from the Mexican government that combines administrative data on program participation with survey data to study the effects of social protection programs on educational outcomes of explore how investment can mitigate the impacts of hazards and disruption.", "dataset": ["data on hydro-meteorological hazards", "road disruptions", "dataset on network infrastructure investment"], "topic": ["Transport", "Disaster Risk Management"]}]
